Reviews.Title: Great pictures and excellent price.
Reviews.Author: Eric R. Gordon "Goatmeat"
Reviews.Content: Don't know why anyone hates this camera.  I find that it takes excellent pictures in the 10 megapixel mode.  Haven't tried the video yet but I expect the same quality.  The size is perfect for carrying around all the time.  Battery life for the size is normal.  Pictures save to memory card really quickly compared to other cameras I've tried.  Great quality, ease of use, built in flash, great photo program included in package.  USB cord connects to the computer and downloads the pictures effortlessly.  I give this camera a full 5 star rating! Oh, and the price is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Never have been able to get it to work right
Reviews.Author: Denise Kuha
Reviews.Content: My mother bought this for herself two years ago. Neither she nor any of us, her adult children, have been able to get it to take a decent photo. It seems stuck on some weird zoom range and photos are always blurry. Based on other reviews I think the motherboards on a bunch of these must have been defective.  We have all tried every thing we know, every time we come visit her, by experimenting with all the settings, but nothing has worked. Now of course the warranty has expired. This is a terrible, terrible, terrible camera. It is a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Can't ask for more...
Reviews.Author: DA
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great camera! It's easy to use and is loaded with features. I definitely recommend especially for digital camera newbies.

Reviews.Title: This is a terrible camera. I have never seen one this bad...
Reviews.Author: P. Breakfield IV "Tom Steele"
Reviews.Content: One of the positive reviewers says that they don't know why anyone would hate this camera... I find that funny because I can't understand how anyone could like this camera.First off, it takes terrible blurry picture. I am a photography enthusiast and take lots of different types of photos with my Canon 7D. I know my way around digital cameras. We also have a Canon Powershot S95 which is an excellent (but pricey) carry around camera.My daughter has a toy camera that adds sparkles, fairy wings, balloons and more to her pictures, but it is very low resolution and is a kid camera. She wanted a grow up camera.I figured at this price I would try the Vivitar X029.What a disaster. Defaults are at 3mp and it is set to fine quality instead of super fine. Why would they do that?Here are the deal,breakers though.1. the auto white balance is terrible. You end up with pictures that have a strange orange tint to them unless you shoot outside in bright sunlight only.2. The camera DEFAULTS to FLASH OFF. Not AUTO, but it turns the flash off.  So every time you turn on the camera, you have to go into the settings and change it to AUTO FLASH.Why would they do that? Why wouldn't they make AUTO use AUTO FLASH so that the camera would decide whether to use flash or not, based on the available lighting? It defies all logic...This is a terrible, terrible camera.

Reviews.Title: Average Camera
Reviews.Author: Johnny L. Collett
Reviews.Content: Bought used...Slow Shutter Speeds...poor focus attributes in low light but a good throw-around camera to carry in the backpac or tacklebox!

Reviews.Title: No Auto-focus, worthless.
Reviews.Author: Holly Weissman "Chaoseeker"
Reviews.Content: NO AUTO FOCUS. Unless you have very good spacial awareness, or you just get lucky, all this camera is going to give you is blurry pictures. This is the only point and shoot I've ever seen without auto-focus. I thought I was crazy not being able to get it to work and then I actually called customer support and they told me "No, this camera does not have that feature". I've never heard of such a thing on a consumer point and shoot, especially one that cost as much as this. NOT worth the money. I just got it as a Christmas gift, and I'll be returning it as fast as I can. What a waste, but I'm not going to run around with my fingers crossed, hoping I'm the right distance from my subject that I'm going to get a clear shot. Worthless.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: CarolinaMorning
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 8 year old neice for a birthday present.  I went off the reviews saying it was great for kids.  I should have read further.  The picture quaility is dark and grainy at best.  I even played around with the settings to see if I could lighten and clear the picture.  It didnt help.  I would suggest buying a different camera.  Lucky for me I enough time to order a new one.  If you are looking at this camera, take my word, pass on it.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: JeffS
Reviews.Content: I bought this item some time ago. I does what was advertised. I am satisfied with the purchase. My granddaughter in law loves it- 7 y.o. [This Amazon's requirements to post no less than 20 words is annoying! Really. 10-15 words would be more reasonable.]

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for my 8 yr old granddaughter to use! She loves it and uses it for pictures as well as videoing! She removes the memory stick and loads it on her digital picture album

Reviews.Title: Poor Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bloksa
Reviews.Content: I Bought this camera for my sister, it's her first camera and i wanted to buy something cheap because she is young and it was her first experience with a device like this, but i'm so disappointed on this one, it has poor picture quality, the user interface it's so mean and the flashlight it has to be set up manually. Also my 2 Mp cellphone take better pictures at night, i have to recommend don't buy this cheap and bad camera, expend a little more and bring home a better device

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Lilac
Reviews.Content: I had a similar experience with the other reviewer that said the pictures were always blurry and that it seemed to be stuck on some strange setting (even though I scrolled through all the settings menus).  Also, a few of the photos appeared warped!  Unless you like fun-house type photos don't bother with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Price - Features - Friendly user  RELATION
Reviews.Author: fabito
Reviews.Content: shipped on time, arrived on time. Very accurate description on the item. Actually this is my second time w/ this same product cuz the first one have been stolen from me. For its price it is a very complete camera, with basic and little advance features. Light weight, very easy to use. NO problem at all about connecting with laptop, NO problem with any kind of MicroSD memory; it accepts up to 16 or 32 gb's (NOT SURE, ha!) Anyway Im happy i bought it again.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment
Reviews.Author: J. Higginson "QuiltMama"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera just before Christmas 2011, mainly because it was advertised for $49 (supposedly half price) and at a quick glance it seemed to have all the features that I was looking for.  I need a small, lightweight camera that can take very good closeup shots.  Wow, this camera is awful!  Every single photo I've taken, whether they be closeup or distance shots, have come out extremely grainy and blurry.  I've searched the menus hoping to find a different setting that might take care of these problems.  Nothing.  Don't waste your money on this thing.

Reviews.Title: cheap!
Reviews.Author: alwayson
Reviews.Content: cheap and grainy photos, would not use again. do not buy this!Piece of crap, cheap! do not use it other than for emergency photos. my cell phone takes better photos.

Reviews.Title: This item is just junk.
Reviews.Author: Terri Linzmeier "Terri J"
Reviews.Content: I was able to get this little digital camera for 30% off the clearance price at Kohl's, so only paid $36 for it.  And even for $36, it's a waste of money.  Just a piece of junk.  Don't buy it.  Lots of reasons.  Just trust me on this one... get a cheap Canon or Kodak camera instead.

Reviews.Title: Don't wast you money on this!!!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This camera is horrible!! Like you the price is was I liked best about this camera.  I was looking at buying a cheap camera for my 8 year old son for Christmas and this camera looked like it would do the trick.  After trying it out I then realized how bad this camera was.  It went through the batteries like they was candy.  The display was real grainy.  The photos was horrible.  Any little movement caused the photo to be blurry.  I bought my camera at Office Max and took it back the following Monday.

Reviews.Title: vivitar vivicam
Reviews.Author: A you "tells it how it is"
Reviews.Content: I didnt expect much from this camera because it was so cheap but you can't tell what any of the pictures are at all. Very disappointed with it, I should have just spent more money for something better.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.1 Megapixels of Image Resolution: With 10 million pixels of image information, the Vivitar ViviCam X029 can produce stunning, photo quality prints up to 16" x 20".
Bright 2.7-inch LCD: A bright 2.7" LCD that is great for viewing images anywhere, anytime. The anti-reflective coating reduces glare so the display is easier to view in bright light.
4x Digital Zoom: Get 4x Closer to the action and never miss a shot.
Face Detection: The Face-Detection system automatically detects and achieves sharp focus on people's faces wherever they are in the frame for crisp, sharp portraits.
ViviLink: Links images and video to all your favorite blogging sites like: Facebook, Myspace, Twitter, YouTube, Flickr and more.
ProductInfo.Name: Vivitar Vivicam X209 10.1 Megapixel Digital Camera with 4x Digital Zoom and 2.4" Viewing Screen - Strawberry finish
